standard.description: These tests help support Accessibility standards. They are not substitutes for screen reader tests and other manual tests.

test.test_name: Page JS should avoid intervals and timeouts
test.query_clob:
with aap as (select case
                    when ((lower(trim(JAVASCRIPT_CODE)) like '%setinterval%'
                             or lower(trim(JAVASCRIPT_CODE)) like '%settimeout%'
                             or lower(trim(JAVASCRIPT_CODE_ONLOAD)) like '%setinterval%'
                             or lower(trim(JAVASCRIPT_CODE_ONLOAD)) like '%settimeout%')) 
                    then 'N' 
                    else 'Y'
                    end pass_yn,
                    application_id,
                    page_id,
                    build_option,
                    page_mode,
                    created_by,
                    created_on,
                    last_updated_by,
                    last_updated_on,
                    page_name,
						        workspace
            from apex_application_pages a

)
select aap.pass_yn,                          
       aap.application_id, 
       aap.page_id,
       aap.created_by,
       aap.created_on,
       aap.last_updated_by,
       aap.last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('Page `%0` (app %1, page %2) has inaccessible JS', 
        p0 => aap.page_name, 
        p1 => aap.application_id,
        p2 => aap.page_id) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Page `%0` (app %1, page %2) has inaccessible JS', 
        p0 => aap.page_name, 
        p1 => aap.application_id,
        p2 => aap.page_id) issue_title,
       aap.page_id component_id,
       null parent_component_id,
       aap.page_name,
       aap.page_mode,
			 aap.workspace
from aap
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo2 on aabo2.build_option_name = aap.build_option
                                                     and aabo2.application_id = aap.application_id
where aap.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
and coalesce(aabo2.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
test.explanation:
Avoid setting intervals and timeouts with Javascript as it can impact the accessibility of your page.

This test is tied to the following WCAG Codes :

1.  2.2.2(A) : Pause, Stop, Hide:  
    For moving, blinking, scrolling, or auto-updating information, all of the following are true:
    
    Moving, blinking, scrolling  
    For any moving, blinking or scrolling information that (1) starts automatically, (2) lasts more than five seconds, and (3) is presented in parallel with other content, there is a mechanism for the user to pause, stop, or hide it unless the movement, blinking, or scrolling is part of an activity where it is essential; and
    
    Auto-updating  
    For any auto-updating information that (1) starts automatically and (2) is presented in parallel with other content, there is a mechanism for the user to pause, stop, or hide it or to control the frequency of the update unless the auto-updating is part of an activity where it is essential.
    
2.  2.3.1(A) : Three Flashes or Below Threshold:  
    Web pages do not contain anything that flashes more than three times in any one second period, or the flash is below the general flash and red flash thr~

test.test_name: Region names should be descriptive
test.query_clob:
select case when aapr.region_name = '&nbsp'
            then 'N'
            else 'Y'
            end pass_yn,
       aapr.workspace,
       aapr.application_id, 
       aapr.page_id,
       null created_by,
       null created_on,
       aapr.last_updated_by,
       aapr.last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('Region `%0` (app %1, page %2) has an inaccessible name', 
        p0 => aapr.region_name, 
        p1 => aapr.application_id,
        p2 => aapr.page_id) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Region `%0` has an inaccessible name (app %1, page %2)', 
        p0 => aapr.region_name, 
        p1 => aapr.application_id,
        p2 => aapr.page_id,
        p3 => aapr.region_id) issue_title,
       aapr.region_id component_id,
       aapr.parent_region_id parent_component_id,
       aapr.region_name,
       aapr.template,
       aapr.display_position,
       aapr.source_type,
       aapr.component_template_options,
       aapr.report_template
from apex_application_page_regions aapr
inner join apex_application_pages aap on aap.page_id = aapr.page_id
                                      and aap.application_id = aapr.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo1 on  aabo1.build_option_name = aap.build_option
                                                     and aabo1.application_id = aap.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo2 on  aabo2.build_option_name = aapr.build_option
                                                     and aabo2.application_id = aapr.application_id
where aapr.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
and coalesce(aabo1.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
and coalesce(aabo2.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
test.explanation: Region names often show up as landmarks, and so should be helpful
test.fix: Give the region a descriptive name

test.test_name: Regions with HTML images should have alt text
test.query_clob:
with std as (select case
                     when (coalesce((length(lower(region_source)) - length(replace(lower(region_source),'<img',null)))/4, length(lower(region_source)), 0) > 
                                coalesce((length(lower(region_source)) - length(replace(lower(region_source),'alt="',null)))/5, length(lower(region_source)), 0)) or
                                lower(replace(region_source,' ','')) like '%alt=""%' or
                                lower(region_source) like '% alt %'
                     then 'N'  
                     else 'Y'
                     end pass_yn,
                     to_char(substr(region_source,1,4000)) src,
                     application_id,page_id,region_id, workspace
            from apex_application_page_regions
            where lower(region_source) like '%<img%'
            union
            select case
                   when (coalesce((length(lower(region_header_text)) - length(replace(lower(region_header_text),'<img',null)))/4, length(lower(region_header_text)), 0) > 
                                coalesce((length(lower(region_header_text)) - length(replace(lower(region_header_text),'alt="',null)))/5, length(lower(region_header_text)), 0)) or
                                lower(replace(region_header_text,' ','')) like '%alt=""%' or
                                lower(region_header_text) like '% alt %'
                   then 'N'
                   else 'Y'
                   end pass_yn,
                   region_header_text,
                   application_id,page_id,region_id, workspace
            from apex_application_page_regions
            where lower(REGION_HEADER_TEXT) like '%<img%'
            union
            select case
                   when (coalesce((length(lower(region_footer_text)) - length(replace(lower(region_footer_text),'<img',null)))/4, length(lower(region_footer_text)), 0) > 
                               coalesce((length(lower(region_footer_text)) - length(replace(lower(region_footer_text),'alt="',null)))/5, length(lower(region_footer_text)), 0)) or
                               lower(replace(region_footer_text,' ','')) like '%alt=""%' or
                               lower(region_footer_text) like '% alt %'
                   then 'N'
                   else 'Y'
                   end pass_yn,
                   region_footer_text,
                   application_id,page_id,region_id, workspace
            from apex_application_page_regions
            where lower(REGION_FOOTER_TEXT) like '%<img%'
)
select std.pass_yn,                          
       aapr.application_id, 
       aapr.page_id,
       null created_by,
       null created_on,
       aapr.last_updated_by,
       aapr.last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('Region `%0` (app %1, page %2) has an image with no alt text (`%3`)', 
        p0 => aapr.region_name, 
        p1 => aapr.application_id,
        p2 => aapr.page_id,
        p3 => substr(std.src,1,50)) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Region `%0` has an image with no alt text (app %1, page %2, region id %3)', 
        p0 => aapr.region_name, 
        p1 => aapr.application_id,
        p2 => aapr.page_id,
				p3 => aapr.region_id) issue_title,
       aapr.region_id component_id,
       null parent_component_id,
       aapr.region_name,
       aapr.template,
       aapr.display_position,
       aapr.source_type,
       std.src,
			 std.workspace
from std
inner join apex_application_page_regions aapr on std.region_id = aapr.region_id
                                              and std.application_id = aapr.application_id
inner join apex_application_pages aap on aap.page_id = aapr.page_id and aap.application_id = aapr.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo1 on aabo1.build_option_name = aap.build_option
                                                     and aabo1.application_id = aap.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo2 on aabo2.build_option_name = aapr.build_option
                                                     and aabo2.application_id = aapr.application_id
where std.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
and coalesce(aabo1.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
and coalesce(aabo2.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
test.explanation:
All images need alt text to make them accessible to screen-readers.

This test is tied to the following WCAG Codes :

1.  1.1.1(A) : Non-text Content:  
    All non-text content that is presented to the user has a text alternative that serves the equivalent purpose, except for the situations listed below.
test.fix: Add alt text to your image. Eg. ``

test.test_name: Card Actions should avoid hard coded tab indexes
test.query_clob:
with aapc as (select case
                     when (lower(trim(link_attributes)) like '%tabindex%' ) 
                     then 'N' 
                     else 'Y'
                   end pass_yn,
                   page_id,
                   application_id,
                   link_attributes,
                   last_updated_by,
                   last_updated_on,
                   label,
                   action_type,
                   build_option,
                   action_id,
							     workspace
             from apex_appl_page_card_actions)
select aapc.pass_yn,                          
       aapc.application_id, 
       aapc.page_id,
       null created_by,
       null created_on,
       aapc.last_updated_by,
       aapc.last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('Card Actions `%0` (app %1, page %2) has hard coded tab index ', 
        p0 => coalesce(aapc.label,aapc.action_type), 
        p1 => aapc.application_id,
        p2 => aapc.page_id) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Card Actions `%0` (app %1, page %2) has hard coded tab index', 
        p0 => coalesce(aapc.label,aapc.action_type), 
        p1 => aapc.application_id,
        p2 => aapc.page_id) issue_title,
       aapc.action_id component_id,
       null parent_component_id,
       aapc.label,
       aapc.action_type,
			 aapc.workspace
from  aapc
inner join apex_application_pages aap on aap.page_id = aapc.page_id and aap.application_id = aapc.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo1 on aabo1.build_option_name = aap.build_option
                                                     and aabo1.application_id = aap.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo2 on aabo2.build_option_name = aapc.build_option
                                                     and aabo2.application_id = aapc.application_id
where aapc.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
and coalesce(aabo1.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
and coalesce(aabo2.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
test.explanation:
It is inadvisable to alter the default tabindex of elements on a page because it can cause the experience between the sighted and unsighted users to diverge.

This test is tied to the following WCAG Codes :

1.  2.4.3(A) : Focus Order : If a Web page can be navigated sequentially and the navigation sequences affect meaning or operation, focusable components receive focus in an order that preserves meaning and operability.

test.test_name: Pages have name, title and not a blank space
test.query_clob:
with aap as (select case
                 when (trim(page_name) is null or lower(trim(page_name)) = ' '
                           or trim(page_title) is null or lower(trim(page_title)) = ' ') 
                      then 'N' 
                     else 'Y'
                   end pass_yn,
                   application_id, 
						       page_id,
						       page_name,page_title, page_mode,
                   created_by,created_on,last_updated_by,last_updated_on, 
						       build_option,
						       workspace
              from apex_application_pages
             where page_function != 'Global Page'
)
select aap.pass_yn,                          
       aap.application_id, 
       aap.page_id,
       aap.created_by,
       aap.created_on,
       aap.last_updated_by,
       aap.last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('Page `%0` (app %1, page %2) is missing a name (`%0`) or title (`%3`)', 
        p0 => aap.page_name, 
        p1 => aap.application_id,
        p2 => aap.page_id,
        p3 => aap.page_title) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Page `%0` (app %1, page %2) is missing a name or title', 
        p0 => aap.page_name, 
        p1 => aap.application_id,
        p2 => aap.page_id) issue_title,
       aap.page_id component_id,
       null parent_component_id,
       aap.page_name,
       aap.page_mode,
       aap.page_title,
			 aap.workspace
from aap
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo2 on aabo2.build_option_name = aap.build_option
                                                     and aabo2.application_id = aap.application_id
where aap.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
and coalesce(aabo2.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
test.explanation:
Page must have non-blank titles and names for the benefit of screen-readers.

This test is tied to the following WCAG Codes :

1.  2.5.3(A) : Label in Name: For user interface components with labels that include text or images of text, the name contains the text that is presented visually.
2.  3.3.2(A) : Labels or Instructions:  
    Labels or instructions are provided when content requires user input.
3.  4.1.2(A) : Name, Role, Value : For all user interface components (including but not limited to: form elements, links and components generated by scripts), the name and role can be programmatically determined; states, properties, and values that can be set by the user can be programmatically set; and notification of changes to these items is available to user agents, including assistive technologies.
4.  2.4.6(AA) : Headings and labels describe topic or purpose.
test.fix: Give the page a descriptive name and title

test.test_name: IR columns need unique labels
test.query_clob:
with aapi as (
        select ROW_NUMBER( ) OVER (PARTITION BY application_id,page_id,region_id,trim(lower(form_label)) ORDER BY display_order NULLS LAST) value_dup_cnt,
                   application_id,
                   page_id,
                   region_id,
                   region_name,
                   report_label,
                   column_alias,
                   display_order,
                   created_by,
                   created_on,
                   updated_by,
                   updated_on,
                   build_option,
                   display_text_as,
                   column_id,
                   form_label,
	                 workspace
              from apex_application_page_ir_col
    )
select case when aapi.value_dup_cnt > 1 
            then 'N' 
            else 'Y'
            end pass_yn,                          
       aapi.application_id, 
       aapi.page_id,
       aapi.created_by,
       aapi.created_on,
       aapi.updated_by last_updated_by,
       aapi.updated_on last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('Interactive Report Column `%4` (app %1, page %2, region `%3`, `%0`) is not unique . Column labels should be unique to the page for accessibility.', 
        p0 => aapi.column_alias, 
        p1 => aapi.application_id,
        p2 => aapi.page_id,
        p3 => aapi.region_name,
        p4 => aapi.form_label) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Interactive Report Column `%4` (app %1, page %2, region `%3`, `%0`) is not unique', 
        p0 => aapi.column_alias, 
        p1 => aapi.application_id,
        p2 => aapi.page_id,
        p3 => aapi.region_name,
        p4 => aapi.form_label) issue_title,
       aapi.column_id component_id,
       null parent_component_id,
       aapi.column_alias,
       aapi.report_label,
       aapi.display_text_as,
			 aapi.workspace
from aapi
inner join apex_application_pages aap on aap.page_id = aapi.page_id and aap.application_id = aapi.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo1 on aabo1.build_option_name = aap.build_option
                                                     and aabo1.application_id = aap.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo2 on aabo2.build_option_name = aapi.build_option
                                                     and aabo2.application_id = aapi.application_id
where aapi.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
and coalesce(aabo1.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
and coalesce(aabo2.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
test.explanation:
This plausibly affects sighted users as much as screen-reader users. Column headings should be unique for clarity.

This test is tied to the following WCAG Codes :

1.  2.5.3(A) : Label in Name: For user interface components with labels that include text or images of text, the name contains the text that is presented visually.
2.  3.3.2(A) : Labels or Instructions:  
    Labels or instructions are provided when content requires user input.
3.  4.1.2(A) : Name, Role, Value : For all user interface components (including but not limited to: form elements, links and components generated by scripts), the name and role can be programmatically determined; states, properties, and values that can be set by the user can be programmatically set; and notification of changes to these items is available to user agents, including assistive technologies.
4.  2.4.6(AA) : Headings and labels describe topic or purpose.

test.test_name: Page items with html images have alt text
test.query_clob:
with std as (select case
                    when display_as = 'Display Image'
                    then case when attribute_01 = 'DB_COLUMN' 
                              and trim(attribute_03) is null
                              then 'N'
                              when attribute_01 = 'SQL' 
                              and ((coalesce((length(lower(html_form_element_attributes)) - length(replace(lower(html_form_element_attributes),'<img',null)))/4, length(lower(html_form_element_attributes)), 0) > 
                                  coalesce((length(lower(html_form_element_attributes)) - length(replace(lower(html_form_element_attributes),'alt="',null)))/5, length(lower(html_form_element_attributes)), 0)) 
                                  or lower(replace(html_form_element_attributes,' ','')) like '%alt=""%' 
                                  or lower(html_form_element_attributes) like '% alt %' 
                                  or trim(html_form_element_attributes) is null)
                              then 'N'
                              when attribute_01 = 'URL' 
                              and trim(attribute_02) is null
                              then 'N'
                              else 'Y'
                              end 
                    when lower(item_source) like '%<img%'
                    then case when (coalesce((length(lower(item_source)) - length(replace(lower(item_source),'<img',null)))/4, length(lower(item_source)), 0) > 
                                  coalesce((length(lower(item_source)) - length(replace(lower(item_source),'alt="',null)))/5, length(lower(item_source)), 0))
                              or lower(replace(item_source,' ','')) like '%alt=""%' 
                              or lower(item_source) like '% alt %'
                              then 'N'
                              else 'Y'
                              end
                    when lower(pre_element_text) like '%<img%'
                    then case when (coalesce((length(lower(pre_element_text)) - length(replace(lower(pre_element_text),'<img',null)))/4, length(lower(pre_element_text)), 0) > 
                                  coalesce((length(lower(pre_element_text)) - length(replace(lower(pre_element_text),'alt="',null)))/5, length(lower(pre_element_text)), 0)) 
                              or lower(replace(pre_element_text,' ','')) like '%alt=""%' 
                              or lower(pre_element_text) like '% alt %'
                              then 'N'
                              else 'Y'
                              end
                    when lower(post_element_text) like '%<img%'
                    then case when (coalesce((length(lower(post_element_text)) - length(replace(lower(post_element_text),'<img',null)))/4, length(lower(post_element_text)), 0) > 
                                  coalesce((length(lower(post_element_text)) - length(replace(lower(post_element_text),'alt="',null)))/5, length(lower(post_element_text)), 0)) 
                              or lower(replace(post_element_text,' ','')) like '%alt=""%' 
                              or lower(post_element_text) like '% alt %'
                              then 'N'
                              else 'Y'
                              end
                    else 'Y'
                    end pass_yn, 
                    html_form_element_attributes src,
                    application_id,
                    page_id,
                    item_id,
                    workspace,
                    attribute_01,
                    html_form_element_attributes,
                    attribute_03,
                    attribute_02,
                    item_source,
                    pre_element_text,
                    post_element_text,
                    display_as,
                    html_table_cell_attr_element
                from apex_application_page_items)
select std.pass_yn,                          
       aapi.application_id, 
       aapi.page_id,
       null created_by,
       null created_on,
       aapi.last_updated_by,
       aapi.last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('%4 Page Item `%0` (app %1, page %2) has an image with missing alt text (`%3`) [Based on : `%5`, alt text : `%6`]', 
        p0 => aapi.item_name, 
        p1 => aapi.application_id,
        p2 => aapi.page_id,
        p3 => std.src,
        p4 => std.display_as,
        p5 => std.attribute_01,
        p6 => std.attribute_02
        ) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Page Item `%0` (app %1, page %2) has an image with missing alt text', 
        p0 => aapi.item_name, 
        p1 => aapi.application_id,
        p2 => aapi.page_id) issue_title,
       aapi.item_id component_id,
       null parent_component_id,
       aapi.item_name,
       std.src,
       std.workspace,
       std.attribute_01 based_on,
       std.html_form_element_attributes custom_attributes,
       std.attribute_03,
       std.attribute_02 alternative_text,
       std.item_source,
       std.pre_element_text,
       std.post_element_text,
       std.display_as,
       std.html_table_cell_attr_element column_attributes
from std
inner join apex_application_page_items aapi on std.application_id = aapi.application_id
                                            and std.page_id = aapi.page_id 
                                            and std.item_id = aapi.item_id
inner join apex_application_pages aap on aap.page_id = aapi.page_id and aap.application_id = aapi.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo1 on aabo1.build_option_name = aap.build_option
                                                     and aabo1.application_id = aap.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo2 on aabo2.build_option_name = aapi.build_option
                                                     and aabo2.application_id = aapi.application_id
where std.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
and coalesce(aabo1.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
and coalesce(aabo2.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
test.explanation:
This test is tied to the following WCAG Codes :

1.  1.1.1(A) : Non-text Content:  
    All non-text content that is presented to the user has a text alternative that serves the equivalent purpose, except for the situations listed below.
test.fix:
If the Page Item is of type 'Display Image':

*   if it is `based on` a `Image URL stored in Page Item Value` or `BLOB Column specified in Item Source` , you must supply a title + an aria-label to the `Alternative Text` (under settings) attribute

test.test_name: Pages should avoid hardcoding tab indexes
test.query_clob:
with aap as (
    select case
         when lower(trim(dialog_attributes)) like '%tabindex%' 
         then 'N' 
         else 'Y'
         end pass_yn,
       page_id,
       page_name,
       application_id,
       dialog_attributes,
       created_by,
       created_on,
       last_updated_by,
       last_updated_on,
       build_option,
       page_mode,
	     workspace
    from apex_application_pages)
select aap.pass_yn,                          
       aap.application_id, 
       aap.page_id,
       aap.created_by,
       aap.created_on,
       aap.last_updated_by,
       aap.last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('Page `%0` (app %1, page %2) has a hardcoded tab index: `%3`', 
        p0 => aap.page_name, 
        p1 => aap.application_id,
        p2 => aap.page_id,
				p3 => aap.dialog_attributes) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Page `%0` (app %1, page %2) has a hardcoded tab index', 
        p0 => aap.page_name, 
        p1 => aap.application_id,
        p2 => aap.page_id) issue_title,
       aap.page_id component_id,
       null parent_component_id,
       aap.page_name,
       aap.page_mode,
			 aap.dialog_attributes,
			 aap.workspace
from aap
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo2 on aabo2.build_option_name = aap.build_option
                                                     and aabo2.application_id = aap.application_id
where aap.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
and coalesce(aabo2.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
test.explanation:
It is inadvisable to alter the default tabindex of elements on a page because it can cause the experience between the sighted and unsighted users to diverge.

This test is tied to the following WCAG Codes :

test.test_name: Regions on a page must be unique
test.query_clob:
with aapr as (select application_id,
                      page_id,
                      region_name,
                      parent_region_name,
                      display_sequence, 
                      build_option, 
                      source_type, 
                      display_position, 
                      template, 
                      region_id, 
                      last_updated_on, 
                      last_updated_by,
							        workspace,
                      row_number( ) over (partition by workspace,application_id,page_id,trim(lower(region_name)) order by display_sequence nulls last) value_dup_cnt
                  from apex_application_page_regions
             )
select case when aapr.value_dup_cnt > 1 
            then 'N' 
            else 'Y'
            end pass_yn,                          
       aapr.application_id, 
       aapr.page_id,
       null created_by,
       null created_on,
       aapr.last_updated_by,
       aapr.last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('There is more than one region `%0` on page %2 (app %1,  display sequence %3, parent region `%4`, region id %5). Region names must be unique for accessibility.', 
        p0 => aapr.region_name, 
        p1 => aapr.application_id,
        p2 => aapr.page_id,
        p3 => aapr.display_sequence,
        p4 => aapr.parent_region_name,
        p5 => aapr.region_id) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Region `%0` on page %2 is not unique (app %1, region id %5)', 
        p0 => aapr.region_name, 
        p1 => aapr.application_id,
        p2 => aapr.page_id,
        p5 => aapr.region_id) issue_title,
       aapr.region_id component_id,
       null parent_component_id,
       aapr.region_name,
       aapr.template,
       aapr.display_position,
       aapr.source_type,
       aapr.display_sequence,
       aapr.parent_region_name,
			 aapr.workspace
from aapr
inner join apex_application_pages aap on aap.page_id = aapr.page_id and aap.application_id = aapr.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo1 on aabo1.build_option_name = aap.build_option
                                                     and aabo1.application_id = aap.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo2 on aabo2.build_option_name = aapr.build_option
                                                     and aabo2.application_id = aapr.application_id
where aapr.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
and coalesce(aabo1.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
and coalesce(aabo2.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
test.explanation:
Screen-readers announce buttons and page items in the context of their parent region. Consequently, it helps for region names to be unique per page.

This test is tied to the following WCAG Codes :

1.  2.5.3(A) : Label in Name: For user interface components with labels that include text or images of text, the name contains the text that is presented visually.
2.  3.3.2(A) : Labels or Instructions:  
    Labels or instructions are provided when content requires user input.
3.  4.1.2(A) : Name, Role, Value : For all user interface components (including but not limited to: form elements, links and components generated by scripts), the name and role can be programmatically determined; states, properties, and values that can be set by the user can be programmatically set; and notification of changes to these items is available to user agents, including assistive technologies.
4.  2.4.6(AA) : Headings and labels describe topic or purpose.
test.fix: Make the region names more descriptive

test.test_name: Reports should have Row Headers
test.query_clob:
with rpt_cols as (
       select pic.application_id, 
              pic.page_id, 
              pic.region_name, 
              pic.use_as_row_header,
              pic.region_id, 
              'IR' report_type,
              pic.created_by,
              pic.created_on,
              pic.updated_by,
              pic.updated_on,
              pic.column_id,
              pic.workspace,
              pic.build_option
       from v_svt_apex_application_page_ir_col pic
       union all
       select pig.application_id, 
              pig.page_id, 
              pig.region_name, 
              pig.use_as_row_header,
              pig.region_id, 
              'IG' report_type,
              null created_by,
              null created_on,
              pig.last_updated_by,
              pig.last_updated_on,
              pig.column_id,
              pig.workspace,
              pig.build_option
       from apex_appl_page_ig_columns pig 
       union all
       select prc.application_id, 
              prc.page_id, 
              prc.region_name, 
              prc.use_as_row_header,
              prc.region_id, 
              'C' report_type,
              null created_by,
              null created_on,
              prc.last_updated_by,
              prc.last_updated_on,
              prc.region_report_column_id,
              prc.workspace,
              prc.build_option
       from apex_application_page_rpt_cols prc 
       where column_is_hidden = 'No'
),
rpt_cols_fm as (
       select rc.application_id, 
              rc.page_id, 
              rc.region_name, 
              rc.use_as_row_header,
              rc.region_id, 
              rc.report_type,
              apex_string.format(
              p_message => q'^`%0` is missing a row header (App : %1, Page : %2, Region id : %3). Regions that support row headers should have a column with the "Use as Row Header" attribute set to Yes for accessibility reasons.^',
              p0 => rc.region_name,
              p1 => rc.application_id,
              p2 => rc.page_id,
              p3 => rc.region_id
              ) validation_failure_message,
              apex_string.format(
              p_message => '`%0` is missing a row header (app %1, page %2, region id %3)',
              p0 => rc.region_name,
              p1 => rc.application_id,
              p2 => rc.page_id,
              p3 => rc.region_id
              ) issue_title,
              app.created_by,
              app.created_on,
              coalesce(pr.last_updated_by, app.last_updated_by) last_updated_by, 
              coalesce(pr.last_updated_on, app.last_updated_on) last_updated_on,
              rc.column_id,
              rc.workspace
       from rpt_cols rc 
       inner join apex_application_page_regions pr on  pr.region_id = rc.region_id
                                                   and pr.page_id = rc.page_id 
                                                   and pr.application_id = rc.application_id
                                                   and coalesce(pr.condition_type_code,'NA') != 'NEVER'
       inner join apex_application_pages app on  app.page_id        = rc.page_id
                                             and app.application_id = rc.application_id
       inner join  apex_applications aa on  rc.application_id     = aa.application_id
                                          and aa.availability_status != 'Unavailable'
       left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo1 on  aabo1.build_option_name = app.build_option
                                                            and aabo1.application_id = app.application_id
       left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo2 on  aabo2.build_option_name = rc.build_option
                                                            and aabo2.application_id = rc.application_id
       where coalesce(aabo1.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
       and   coalesce(aabo2.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
)
select case when count(case when rcf.use_as_row_header = 'Yes'
                            then 'x'
                            when rcf.use_as_row_header = 'Y'
                            then 'x'
                            end) > 0
            then 'Y'
            else 'N'
            end  pass_yn,
       rcf.application_id, 
       rcf.page_id, 
       rcf.region_name, 
       rcf.region_id,
       rcf.report_type,
       rcf.created_by,
       rcf.created_on,
       rcf.last_updated_by, 
       rcf.last_updated_on,
       rcf.validation_failure_message,
       rcf.issue_title,
       apr.report_template,
       rcf.region_id component_id,
       null parent_component_id,
       rcf.workspace
from rpt_cols_fm rcf
inner join apex_application_page_regions apr on rcf.region_id = apr.region_id
                                             and coalesce(apr.report_template ,'NA') not in ('List Item')
                                             and apr.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
group by rcf.application_id, 
         rcf.page_id, 
         rcf.region_name, 
         rcf.region_id,
         rcf.report_type,
         rcf.created_by,
         rcf.created_on,
         rcf.last_updated_by, 
         rcf.last_updated_on,
         rcf.validation_failure_message,
         rcf.issue_title,
         apr.report_template,
         rcf.workspace
test.explanation:
One or more columns must have "Value Identifies Row" switched on so that screen readers can better describe individual records of a table.

This test is tied to the following WCAG Codes :

1.  1.1.1(A) : Non-text Content:  
    All non-text content that is presented to the user has a text alternative that serves the equivalent purpose, except for the situations listed below.
2.  1.3.1(A) : Info and Relationships : Information, structure, and relationships conveyed through presentation can be programmatically determined or are available in text.
3.  1.3.2(A) : Meaningful Sequence : When the sequence in which content is presented affects its meaning, a correct reading sequence can be programmatically determined.
test.fix: At the column level of your report, toggle on "Value Identifies Row" for many columns is appropriate to uniquely describe the record in human-friendly terms.

test.explanation:
Avoid CSS that blinks or moves as it can impact the accessibility of your page.

This test is tied to the following WCAG Codes :

1.  2.2.2(A) : Pause, Stop, Hide:  
    For moving, blinking, scrolling, or auto-updating information, all of the following are true:
    
    Moving, blinking, scrolling  
    For any moving, blinking or scrolling information that (1) starts automatically, (2) lasts more than five seconds, and (3) is presented in parallel with other content, there is a mechanism for the user to pause, stop, or hide it unless the movement, blinking, or scrolling is part of an activity where it is essential; and
    
    Auto-updating  
    For any auto-updating information that (1) starts automatically and (2) is presented in parallel with other content, there is a mechanism for the user to pause, stop, or hide it or to control the frequency of the update unless the auto-updating is part of an activity where it is essential.
    
2.  2.3.1(A) : Three Flashes or Below Threshold:  
    Web pages do not contain anything that flashes more than three times in any one second period, or the flash is below the general flash and red flash thr~

test.test_name: Inline with field error notification is insufficient
test.query_clob:
with aapv as (
        select case  when error_display_location = 'INLINE_WITH_FIELD' 
                     then 'N' 
                     else 'Y'
                     end pass_yn,
                application_id,
                page_id, 
                validation_name,
                workspace,
                last_updated_by,
                last_updated_on,
                build_option,
                validation_id,
                error_display_location

    )

       aapv.application_id, 
       aapv.page_id,
       null created_by,
       null created_on,
       aapv.last_updated_by,
       aapv.last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('Page Validation `%0` (app %1, page %2) error display settings are misconfigured: `%3`', 
        p0 => aapv.validation_name, 
        p1 => aapv.application_id,
        p2 => aapv.page_id,
        p3 => aapv.error_display_location) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Page Validation `%0` (app %1, page %2) error display settings are misconfigured', 
        p0 => aapv.validation_name, 
        p1 => aapv.application_id,
        p2 => aapv.page_id) issue_title,
       aapv.validation_id component_id,

       aapv.validation_name,
       aapv.error_display_location
from aapv
inner join apex_application_pages aap on aap.page_id = aapv.page_id
                                      and aap.application_id = aapv.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo1 on  aabo1.build_option_name = aap.build_option
                                                     and aabo1.application_id = aap.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo2 on  aabo2.build_option_name = aapv.build_option
                                                     and aabo2.application_id = aapv.application_id
where aapv.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
and coalesce(aabo1.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
and coalesce(aabo2.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
test.explanation:
Validation error messages should be displayed with the setting `Inline with Field and in Notification` - the other settings are insufficiently accessible.

This test is tied to the following WCAG Codes :

1.  1.3.3(A) : Sensory Characteristics : Instructions provided for understanding and operating content do not rely solely on sensory characteristics of components such as shape, color, size, visual location, orientation, or sound.
2.  1.4.1(A) : Use of Color : Color is not used as the only visual means of conveying information, indicating an action, prompting a response, or distinguishing a visual element.
3.  3.3.1(A) : Error Identification: If an input error is automatically detected, the item that is in error is identified and the error is described to the user in text.
4.  3.3.3(AA) : Error Suggestion : If an input error is automatically detected and suggestions for correction are known, then the suggestions are provided to the user, unless it would jeopardize the security or purpose of the content.
test.fix: Switch the display location to be `Inline with Field and in Notification`

test.test_name: IG Columns may need autocomplete
test.query_clob:
with aapic as (
    select case
             when (lower(trim(b.item_attributes)) not like '%autocomplete%'
                   or trim(b.item_attributes) is null) 
             then 'N' 
             else 'Y'
             end pass_yn,
           b.application_id,
           b.page_id, 
           b.region_id,
           b.region_name, 
           b.source_expression,
           b.item_attributes,
           b.workspace,
           b.build_option,
           b.last_updated_by,
           b.last_updated_on,
           b.name,
           b.item_type,
           b.label,
           b.heading,
           b.parent_column_id,
           b.column_id
    from apex_appl_page_igs a,
         apex_appl_page_ig_columns b
    where a.application_id = b.application_id
      and b.region_id = a.region_id
      and a.is_editable = 'Yes'
      and b.is_query_only = 'No'
      and lower(b.heading) not like '%api%'
      and (
            (lower(b.heading) like '%name%' and (lower(b.heading) like '%first%' or lower(b.heading) like '%last%' or lower(b.heading) like '%family%'))
            or 
            (lower(b.heading) like '%address%')
            or 
            (lower(b.heading) like '%phone number%')
            or 
            (lower(b.heading) like '%mail%')
            or 
            (lower(b.heading) like '%birthday%' or lower(b.heading) like '%bday%')
         )
  )
select aapic.pass_yn,
       aapic.workspace,
       aapic.application_id, 
       aapic.page_id,
       null created_by,
       null created_on,
       aapic.last_updated_by,
       aapic.last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('Interactive Grid Column `%0` (app %1, page %2) may benefit from autocomplete', 
        p0 => aapic.heading, 
        p1 => aapic.application_id,
        p2 => aapic.page_id) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Interactive Grid Column `%0` (app %1, page %2) may benefit from autocomplete', 
        p0 => aapic.heading, 
        p1 => aapic.application_id,
        p2 => aapic.page_id) issue_title,
       aapic.column_id component_id,
       aapic.parent_column_id parent_component_id,
       aapic.heading,
       aapic.label,
       aapic.item_type,
       aapic.name
from aapic
inner join apex_application_pages aap on aap.page_id = aapic.page_id
                                      and aap.application_id = aapic.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo1 on  aabo1.build_option_name = aap.build_option
                                                     and aabo1.application_id = aap.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo2 on  aabo2.build_option_name = aapic.build_option
                                                     and aabo2.application_id = aapic.application_id
where aapic.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
and coalesce(aabo1.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
and coalesce(aabo2.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
test.explanation:
If you are soliciting routine information like name, address, contact info, etc - you can prompt the browser to supply the stored information for the user. This can be big help to all users and users with accessibility-needs especially.

This test is tied to the following WCAG Codes :

1.  1.3.5(AA) : Identify Input Purpose:
    
    The purpose of each input field collecting information about the user can be programmatically determined when:
    
    The input field serves a purpose identified in the Input Purposes for User Interface Components section; and  
    The content is implemented using technologies with support for identifying the expected meaning for form input data.
test.fix: Add the appropriate [autocomplete attribute](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/autocomplete). For example, add `autocomplete="email"` to the `Custom Attributes` field

1.  2.2.2(A) : Pause, Stop, Hide:

test.test_name: Interactive Grid Columns headings are unique
test.query_clob:
with aapi as (select ROW_NUMBER( ) OVER (PARTITION BY application_id,page_id,region_id,trim(lower(heading)) ORDER BY display_sequence NULLS LAST) value_dup_cnt,
                   application_id,
                   page_id,
                   region_id,
                   region_name,
                   heading,
                   SOURCE_EXPRESSION,
                   display_sequence,
                   last_updated_by,
                   last_updated_on,
                   build_option,
                   name,
                   item_type,
                   label,
                   parent_column_id,
                   column_id,
							     workspace
              from apex_appl_page_ig_columns
              where item_type not in ('NATIVE_HIDDEN','NATIVE_ROW_SELECTOR','NATIVE_ROW_ACTION')
            )
select case when (trim(aapi.heading) is null
            or lower(trim(aapi.heading)) = ' ') 
            then 'N' 
            else 'Y'
            end pass_yn,                          
       aapi.application_id, 
       aapi.page_id,
       null created_by,
       null created_on,
       aapi.last_updated_by,
       aapi.last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('Interactive Grid Column heading for `%3` (app %1, page %2) is not unique. Column headings must be unique for accessibility.', 
        p0 => aapi.heading, 
        p1 => aapi.application_id,
        p2 => aapi.page_id,
        p3 => name) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Interactive Grid Column heading for `%3` (app %1, page %2) is not unique', 
        p0 => aapi.heading, 
        p1 => aapi.application_id,
        p2 => aapi.page_id,
        p3 => name) issue_title,
       aapi.column_id component_id,

       aapi.heading,
       aapi.label,
       aapi.item_type,
       aapi.name,

inner join apex_application_pages aap on aap.page_id = aapi.page_id and aap.application_id = aapi.application_id

with aapi as (select case
                     when format_mask like 'IMAGE%' 
                     then 'N' 
                     when (coalesce((length(trim(lower(HTML_EXPRESSION))) - length(replace(trim(lower(HTML_EXPRESSION)),'<img',null)))/4, length(trim(lower(HTML_EXPRESSION))), 0) > 
                          coalesce((length(trim(lower(HTML_EXPRESSION))) - length(replace(trim(lower(HTML_EXPRESSION)),'alt="',null)))/5, length(trim(lower(HTML_EXPRESSION))), 0)) or
                          replace(trim(lower(HTML_EXPRESSION)),' ','') like '%alt=""%' or
                          trim(lower(HTML_EXPRESSION)) like '% alt %' 
                     then 'N' 
                     else 'Y'
                   end pass_yn,
							     HTML_EXPRESSION src,
                   application_id,page_id,region_id,column_alias,
                   created_by,created_on,updated_on,updated_by, build_option, column_id,

            from apex_application_page_ir_col
            where (format_mask like 'IMAGE%' or
                   trim(lower(HTML_EXPRESSION)) like '%<img%'))
select aapi.pass_yn,                          
       aapi.application_id, 
       aapi.page_id,
       aapi.created_by,
       aapi.created_on,
       aapi.updated_on last_updated_by,
       aapi.updated_by last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('Interactive Report Column `%0` (app %1, page %2) has image with no alt text (`%3`)', 
        p0 => aapi.column_alias,

        p2 => aapi.page_id,
				p3 => aapi.src) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Interactive Report Column `%0` (app %1, page %2) has image with no alt text',

       attribute_15,
       last_updated_by,
       last_updated_on,
       build_option,

       column_is_hidden,
       heading,
       region_report_column_id,

    where column_is_hidden = 'No'
    )

       null created_on,

        p2 => aapr.page_id) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Classic Report Column `%0` (app %1, page %2) has a hard coded tab index',

        p2 => aapr.page_id) issue_title,

test.explanation:
It is inadvisable to alter the default tabindex of elements on a page because it can cause the experience between the sighted and unsighted users to diverge.

This test is tied to the following WCAG Codes :

1.  2.4.3(A) : Focus Order : If a Web page can be navigated sequentially and the navigation sequences affect meaning or operation, focusable components receive focus in an order that preserves meaning and operability.

test.test_name: Some fields benefit from an autocomplete attribute
test.query_clob:
with aapi as (select case
                     when (lower(trim(html_form_element_attributes)) not like '%autocomplete%'
                           or trim(html_form_element_attributes) is null) 
                     then 'N' 
                     else 'Y'
                   end pass_yn,
                   application_id,
                   application_name, 
                   page_id, 
                   page_name,
                   region, 
                   item_name,
                   html_form_element_attributes,
                   label,
                   workspace,
                   last_updated_by,
                   last_updated_on,
                   build_option,
                   item_help_text,
                   item_id,
                   display_as,
                   display_as_code
             from apex_application_page_items
             where display_as_code not in ('NATIVE_HIDDEN','NATIVE_CHECKBOX','NATIVE_SINGLE_CHECKBOX', 'NATIVE_RADIOGROUP','NATIVE_YES_NO')
						 and lower(item_name) not like '%api%'
						 and lower(item_name) not like '%addressed%'
             and (
                    (lower(label) like '%name%' and (lower(label) like '%first%' or lower(label) like '%last%' or lower(label) like '%family%'))
                    or 
                    (lower(label) like '%address%')
                    or 
                    (lower(label) like '%phone number%')
                    or 
                    (lower(label) like '%mail%')
                    or 
                    (lower(label) like '%birthday%' or lower(label) like '%bday%')
                 )
 )
select aapi.pass_yn,
       aapi.workspace workspace,
       aapi.application_id, 
       aapi.page_id,
       null created_by,
       null created_on,
       aapi.last_updated_by,
       aapi.last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('`%3`/`%5` Page Item `%0`/`%4` (app %1, page %2) could benefit from an autocomplete attribute', 
        p0 => aapi.item_name, 
        p1 => aapi.application_id,
        p2 => aapi.page_id,
        p3 => aapi.display_as,
        p4 => aapi.label,
        p5 => aapi.display_as_code) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Page Item `%0` (app %1, page %2) is missing autocomplete', 
        p0 => aapi.item_name, 
        p1 => aapi.application_id,
        p2 => aapi.page_id) issue_title,
       aapi.item_id component_id,
       null parent_component_id,
       aapi.item_name,
       aapi.item_help_text,
       aapi.display_as,
       aapi.display_as_code,
       aapi.label,
       esa.type_code
from aapi
inner join v_svt_stds_applications esa on aapi.application_id = esa.apex_app_id
																			 and esa.type_code in ('HUMANX')
inner join apex_application_pages aap on aap.page_id = aapi.page_id
                                      and aap.application_id = aapi.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo1 on  aabo1.build_option_name = aap.build_option
                                                     and aabo1.application_id = aap.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo2 on  aabo2.build_option_name = aapi.build_option
                                                     and aabo2.application_id = aapi.application_id
where aapi.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
and coalesce(aabo1.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
and coalesce(aabo2.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
test.explanation:
If you are soliciting routine information like name, address, contact info, etc - you can prompt the browser to supply the stored information for the user. This can be big help to all users and users with accessibility-needs especially.

This test is tied to the following WCAG Codes :

1.  1.3.5(AA) : Identify Input Purpose:
    
    The purpose of each input field collecting information about the user can be programmatically determined when:
    
    The input field serves a purpose identified in the Input Purposes for User Interface Components section; and  
    The content is implemented using technologies with support for identifying the expected meaning for form input data.
test.fix: Add the appropriate [autocomplete attribute](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/autocomplete). For example, add `autocomplete="email"` to the `Custom Attributes` field

test.test_name: Page JS should avoid focus events

test.explanation:
Avoid affecting or using mouse events with Javascript as it can impact the accessibility of your page.

This test is tied to the following WCAG Codes :

1.  2.5.2(A) : Pointer Cancellation:  
    For functionality that can be operated using a single pointer, at least one of the following is true:
    
    No Down-Event  
    The down-event of the pointer is not used to execute any part of the function;  
    Abort or Undo  
    Completion of the function is on the up-event, and a mechanism is available to abort the function before completion or to undo the function after completion;  
    Up Reversal  
    The up-event reverses any outcome of the preceding down-event;  
    Essential  
    Completing the function on the down-event is essential.

This plausibly affects sighted users as much as screen-reader users. Column headings should be descriptive for clarity.

This test is tied to the following WCAG Codes :

1.  2.5.3(A) : Label in Name: For user interface components with labels that include text or images of text, the name contains the text that is presented visually.
2.  3.3.2(A) : Labels or Instructions:  
    Labels or instructions are provided when content requires user input.
3.  4.1.2(A) : Name, Role, Value : For all user interface components (including but not limited to: form elements, links and components generated by scripts), the name and role can be programmatically determined; states, properties, and values that can be set by the user can be programmatically set; and notification of changes to these items is available to user agents, including assistive technologies.
4.  2.4.6(AA) : Headings and labels describe topic or purpose.

               application_id,

               dynamic_action_name,
               dynamic_action_id,
               last_updated_by,
               last_updated_on,
               build_option,
               when_event_name,
	             workspace
        from apex_application_page_da
    )
select aapd.pass_yn,                          
       aapd.application_id, 
       aapd.page_id,
       null created_by,
       null created_on,
       aapd.last_updated_by,
       aapd.last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('Dynamic Action `%0` (app %1, page %2) uses an inaccessible mouse event: `%3`', 
        p0 => aapd.dynamic_action_name, 
        p1 => aapd.application_id,
        p2 => aapd.page_id,
        p3 => aapd.when_event_name) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Dynamic Action `%0` (app %1, page %2) uses an inaccessible mouse event', 
        p0 => aapd.dynamic_action_name, 
        p1 => aapd.application_id,
        p2 => aapd.page_id) issue_title,
       aapd.dynamic_action_id component_id,
       null parent_component_id,
       aapd.dynamic_action_name,
       aapd.when_event_name,
			 aapd.workspace
from aapd
inner join apex_application_pages aap on aap.page_id = aapd.page_id and aap.application_id = aapd.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo1 on aabo1.build_option_name = aap.build_option
                                                     and aabo1.application_id = aap.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo2 on aabo2.build_option_name = aapd.build_option
                                                     and aabo2.application_id = aapd.application_id
where aapd.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
and coalesce(aabo1.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
and coalesce(aabo2.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
test.explanation:
Avoid using mousevents in Javascript as it can impact the accessibility of your page.

This test is tied to the following WCAG Codes :

1.  2.5.2(A) : Pointer Cancellation:  
    For functionality that can be operated using a single pointer, at least one of the following is true:
    
    No Down-Event  
    The down-event of the pointer is not used to execute any part of the function;  
    Abort or Undo  
    Completion of the function is on the up-event, and a mechanism is available to abort the function before completion or to undo the function after completion;  
    Up Reversal  
    The up-event reverses any outcome of the preceding down-event;  
    Essential  
    Completing the function on the down-event is essential.

test.test_name: Page Items have valid label and no blank spaces

Page Item labels cannot be blank (null / only spaces / \`&nbsp\`) otherwise screen readers cannot announce them correctly.

This test is tied to the following WCAG Codes :

1.  2.5.3(A) : Label in Name: For user interface components with labels that include text or images of text, the name contains the text that is presented visually.
2.  3.3.2(A) : Labels or Instructions:  
    Labels or instructions are provided when content requires user input.
3.  4.1.2(A) : Name, Role, Value : For all user interface components (including but not limited to: form elements, links and components generated by scripts), the name and role can be programmatically determined; states, properties, and values that can be set by the user can be programmatically set; and notification of changes to these items is available to user agents, including assistive technologies.

This test is tied to the following WCAG Codes :

                             or lower(trim(attribute_01)) like '%settimeout%'))

test.explanation:
Avoid setting intervals and timeouts with Javascript as it can impact the accessibility of your page.

This test is tied to the following WCAG Codes :

1.  2.2.2(A) : Pause, Stop, Hide:  
    For moving, blinking, scrolling, or auto-updating information, all of the following are true:
    
    Moving, blinking, scrolling  
    For any moving, blinking or scrolling information that (1) starts automatically, (2) lasts more than five seconds, and (3) is presented in parallel with other content, there is a mechanism for the user to pause, stop, or hide it unless the movement, blinking, or scrolling is part of an activity where it is essential; and
    
    Auto-updating  
    For any auto-updating information that (1) starts automatically and (2) is presented in parallel with other content, there is a mechanism for the user to pause, stop, or hide it or to control the frequency of the update unless the auto-updating is part of an activity where it is essential.
    
2.  2.3.1(A) : Three Flashes or Below Threshold:  
    Web pages do not contain anything that flashes more than three times in any one second period, or the flash is below the general flash and red flash thr~

test.test_name: Page names should be unique
test.query_clob:
with aap as (select application_id,
                    page_id,
                    lower(trim(page_name)) lower_case_page_name,
                    ROW_NUMBER( ) OVER (PARTITION BY workspace, application_id,lower(trim(page_name)) ORDER BY page_id NULLS LAST) value_dup_cnt,
                    created_by,
                    created_on,
                    last_updated_by,
                    last_updated_on,
                    build_option,
                    page_mode,
                    page_name,
						        workspace
            from apex_application_pages)
select case when aap.value_dup_cnt > 1 
            then 'N' 
            else 'Y'
            end pass_yn,                          
       aap.application_id, 
       aap.page_id,
       aap.created_by,
       aap.created_on,
       aap.last_updated_by,
       aap.last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('Page `%0` (app %1, page %2) is not unique. Page names should be unique for accessibility.', 
        p0 => aap.page_name, 
        p1 => aap.application_id,
        p2 => aap.page_id) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Page `%0` (app %1, page %2) is not unique', 
        p0 => aap.page_name, 
        p1 => aap.application_id,
        p2 => aap.page_id) issue_title,
       aap.page_id component_id,
       null parent_component_id,
       aap.page_name,
       aap.page_mode,
			 aap.workspace
from aap
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo2 on aabo2.build_option_name = aap.build_option
                                                     and aabo2.application_id = aap.application_id
where aap.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
and coalesce(aabo2.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
test.explanation:
This plausibly affects sighted users as much as screen-reader users. Page names should be unique for clarity.

This test is tied to the following WCAG Codes :

1.  2.4.2(A) : Page Titled:  
    Web pages have titles that describe topic or purpose.

test.test_name: Page item labels  + region names must be unique

with aapi as (select   dense_rank() over (partition by application_id, page_id, region, trim(lower(label)) order by display_sequence nulls last) therank,
                       application_id, 
                       page_id,

             )

       aapi.application_id,

       null created_by,
       null created_on,
       aapi.last_updated_by,

       apex_string.format('There is more than one Page Item `%3` (`%0`) in a region named `%4` on page %2 (app %1). Page item labels must be unique for accessibility.',

        p4 => aapi.region) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('There is > 1 Page Item label `%0` (`%3`) in a region called `%4` on page %2 (app %1).', 
        p0 => aapi.label, 
        p1 => aapi.application_id,
        p2 => aapi.page_id,
        p3 => aapi.item_name,
        p4 => aapi.region) issue_title,
       aapi.item_id component_id,
       null parent_component_id,

       aapi.workspace,

inner join apex_application_pages aap on aap.page_id = aapi.page_id and aap.application_id = aapi.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo1 on aabo1.build_option_name = aap.build_option
                                                     and aabo1.application_id = aap.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo2 on aabo2.build_option_name = aapi.build_option
                                                     and aabo2.application_id = aapi.application_id

Screen-readers announce page items in the context of their parent region. Consequently, the combination of page item labels and region names must be unique per page.

This test is tied to the following WCAG Codes :

1.  2.5.3(A) : Label in Name: For user interface components with labels that include text or images of text, the name contains the text that is presented visually.
2.  3.3.2(A) : Labels or Instructions:  
    Labels or instructions are provided when content requires user input.
3.  4.1.2(A) : Name, Role, Value : For all user interface components (including but not limited to: form elements, links and components generated by scripts), the name and role can be programmatically determined; states, properties, and values that can be set by the user can be programmatically set; and notification of changes to these items is available to user agents, including assistive technologies.
4.  2.4.6(AA) : Headings and labels describe topic or purpose.
test.fix: Change the page item label or the region name to be unique

test.test_name: Column image links should have alt text
test.query_clob:
select a10.pass_yn,
       a10.application_id,
       a10.page_id,
       a10.region_name,
       a10.column_alias,
       a10.report_label,
       a10.column_linktext,
       a10.column_link_attr,
       a10.created_by, 
       a10.created_on, 
       a10.updated_by last_updated_by, 
       a10.updated_on last_updated_on,
       case when a10.pass_yn = 'N'
            then apex_string.format(
                    p_message => q'^Link Column %1, in report %0, is missing an aria-label. 
                     Report Label/Heading : %2
                     Link text : %3
                     Link attributes : %4.
                     Suggestion : 
                         - remove `alt=""` from the Link Text
                         - add `aria-label="edit #YOUR_COLUMN#"` to the Link Attributes
                    ^',
                    p0 => a10.region_name,
                    p1 => a10.column_alias,
                    p2 => a10.report_label,
                    p3 => a10.column_linktext,
                    p4 => a10.column_link_attr
                    )
            end as validation_failure_message,
       case when a10.pass_yn = 'N'
            then apex_string.format(p_message => q'^Column %1 (page %0, app %2) is missing an aria-label attribute^',
                                    p0 => a10.page_id,
                                    p1 => a10.column_alias,
                                    p2 => a10.application_id
                                    )
            end as issue_title,
      a10.component_id,
      a10.parent_component_id,
			a10.workspace
from (
     select 
     case when ic1.column_linktext is null
          then 'Y'
          when ic1.column_linktext like '%.png%'
          then case when ic1.column_linktext like '%alt=""%'
                    then 'N'
                    when ic1.column_linktext not like '%aria-label%'
                    then case when ic1.column_link_attr is null 
                            then 'N'
                            when ic1.column_link_attr not like '%aria-label%'
                            then 'N'
                            else 'Y'
                            end
                    else 'Y'
                    end
          else 'Y'
          end pass_yn,
     ic1.application_id,
     ic1.page_id,
     ic1.region_name,
     ic1.column_alias,
     ic1.report_label,
     ic1.column_linktext,
     ic1.column_link_attr,
     ic1.column_id component_id,
     null parent_component_id,
     coalesce(ic1.created_by, app.created_by) created_by, 
     coalesce(ic1.created_on, app.created_on) created_on, 
     coalesce(ic1.updated_by, app.last_updated_by) updated_by, 
     coalesce(ic1.updated_on, app.last_updated_on) updated_on,
	   ic1.workspace
     from apex_application_page_ir_col ic1
     inner join apex_application_pages app on  app.page_id = ic1.page_id
                                           and app.application_id = ic1.application_id
     inner join  v_svt_apex_applications aa on ic1.application_id = aa.application_id
                                        and aa.availability_status != 'Unavailable'
                                        and ic1.column_linktext is not null
	   where ic1.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
) a10
test.explanation:
Column image links should have accessible alt text : Link columns in reports that do not feature text (eg. they have the pencil symbol) should include "Alt" text. This alt-text will be displayed by a screen-reader in the web-elements rotor, "link"section.

This test is tied to the following WCAG Codes :

1.  1.1.1(A) : Non-text Content:  
    All non-text content that is presented to the user has a text alternative that serves the equivalent purpose, except for the situations listed below.
test.fix: Add some descriptive text to your alt text. You are encouraged to use substitution variables. For eg: ``

test.test_name: IR Columns should avoid harded tab indexes

with aapi as (
    select case
             when (lower(trim(column_link_attr)) like '%tabindex%' ) 
             then 'N' 
             else 'Y'
           end pass_yn,
           page_id,
           application_id,
           column_link_attr,
           created_by,
           created_on,

           updated_on,
           build_option,

           report_label,
           column_alias,
           column_id,
	         workspace
      from apex_application_page_ir_col
    )
select aapi.pass_yn,                          
       aapi.application_id, 
       aapi.page_id,
       aapi.created_by,
       aapi.created_on,
       aapi.updated_by last_updated_by,
       aapi.updated_on last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('Interactive Report Column `%0` (app %1, page %2) has a hardcoded index', 
        p0 => aapi.column_alias, 
        p1 => aapi.application_id,
        p2 => aapi.page_id) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Interactive Report Column `%0` (app %1, page %2) has a hardcoded index', 
        p0 => aapi.column_alias, 
        p1 => aapi.application_id,
        p2 => aapi.page_id) issue_title,
       aapi.column_id component_id,
       null parent_component_id,
       aapi.column_alias,
       aapi.report_label,
       aapi.display_text_as,
			 aapi.workspace
from aapi
inner join apex_application_pages aap on aap.page_id = aapi.page_id and aap.application_id = aapi.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo1 on aabo1.build_option_name = aap.build_option
                                                     and aabo1.application_id = aap.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo2 on aabo2.build_option_name = aapi.build_option
                                                     and aabo2.application_id = aapi.application_id
where aapi.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
and coalesce(aabo1.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
and coalesce(aabo2.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
test.explanation:

test.test_name: Page regions should avoid hardcoded tab indexes
test.query_clob:
with aapr as (
    select case
         when (    lower(trim(attribute_22)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(attribute_20)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(attribute_09)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(attribute_21)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(attribute_03)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(attribute_11)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(ascending_image_attributes)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(descending_image_attributes)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(attribute_01)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(attribute_05)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(grid_column_attributes)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(attribute_13)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(attribute_06)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(attribute_25)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(attribute_24)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(html_table_cell_attributes)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(attribute_12)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(attribute_18)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(attribute_07)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(attribute_19)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(attribute_16)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(region_attributes_substitution)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(attribute_14)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(attribute_17)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(attribute_08)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(attribute_10)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(attribute_02)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(attribute_15)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(attribute_04)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(attribute_23)) like '%tabindex%' ) then 'N' 
         else 'Y'
       end pass_yn,
       page_id,
       application_id,
       region_attributes_substitution,
       attribute_25,
       attribute_24,
       ascending_image_attributes,
       descending_image_attributes,
       html_table_cell_attributes,
       attribute_01,
       attribute_02,
       attribute_03,
       attribute_04,
       attribute_05,
       attribute_06,
       attribute_07,
       attribute_08,
       attribute_09,
       attribute_10,
       attribute_11,
       attribute_12,
       attribute_13,
       attribute_14,
       attribute_15,
       attribute_16,
       attribute_17,

        p2 => aapr.page_id) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Region `%0` (app %1, page %2) has a hardcoded tab index',

Avoid working with focus events in Javascript as it can impact the accessibility of your page.

This test is tied to the following WCAG Codes :

1.  2.1.2(A) : No Keyboard Trap:  
    If keyboard focus can be moved to a component of the page using a keyboard interface, then focus can be moved away from that component using only a keyboard interface, and, if it requires more than unmodified arrow or tab keys or other standard exit methods, the user is advised of the method for moving focus away.

test.test_name: Classic Columns with images have alt text
test.query_clob:
with std as (select case
                     when format_mask like 'IMAGE%' 
                     then 'N' 
                     when (coalesce((length(trim(lower(HTML_EXPRESSION))) - length(replace(trim(lower(HTML_EXPRESSION)),'<img',null)))/4, length(trim(lower(HTML_EXPRESSION))), 0) > 
                          coalesce((length(trim(lower(HTML_EXPRESSION))) - length(replace(trim(lower(HTML_EXPRESSION)),'alt="',null)))/5, length(trim(lower(HTML_EXPRESSION))), 0)) or
                          replace(trim(lower(HTML_EXPRESSION)),' ','') like '%alt=""%' or
                          trim(lower(HTML_EXPRESSION)) like '% alt %' 
                     then 'N' 
                     else 'Y'
                     end pass_yn,
                   HTML_EXPRESSION src,
                   application_id,application_name,page_id,page_name,region_id,region_name, column_alias,
                   last_updated_by, last_updated_on, build_option, heading, region_report_column_id,
						       workspace
            from apex_application_page_rpt_cols a
            where (format_mask like 'IMAGE%' or
                   trim(lower(HTML_EXPRESSION)) like '%<img%'))
select std.pass_yn,                          
       std.application_id, 
       std.page_id,
       null created_by,
       null created_on,
       std.last_updated_by,
       std.last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('Classic Report Column `%0` (app %1, page %2) has an image with missing alt text: `%3`', 
        p0 => std.heading, 
        p1 => std.application_id,
        p2 => std.page_id,
				p3 => std.src) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Classic Report Column `%0` (app %1, page %2) has an image with missing alt text', 
        p0 => std.heading, 
        p1 => std.application_id,
        p2 => std.page_id) issue_title,
       std.region_report_column_id component_id,
       null parent_component_id,
       std.heading,
			 std.src,
			 std.workspace
from std
inner join apex_application_pages aap on aap.page_id = std.page_id and aap.application_id = std.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo1 on aabo1.build_option_name = aap.build_option
                                                     and aabo1.application_id = aap.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo2 on aabo2.build_option_name = std.build_option
                                                     and aabo2.application_id = std.application_id
where std.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
and coalesce(aabo1.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
and coalesce(aabo2.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'

test.explanation:
It is inadvisable to alter the default tabindex of elements on a page because it can cause the experience between the sighted and unsighted users to diverge.

This test is tied to the following WCAG Codes :

1.  2.4.3(A) : Focus Order : If a Web page can be navigated sequentially and the navigation sequences affect meaning or operation, focusable components receive focus in an order that preserves meaning and operability.

test.test_name: Combo of button labels + region names should be unique / page
test.query_clob:
with aapb as (select application_id,

                     label, 
                     workspace,
                     last_updated_by,

                from apex_application_page_buttons
                where label not in ('Reset', 'Cancel', 'Save', 'Delete'))

            else 'N'

       aapb.workspace,
       aapb.application_id,

       null created_by,
       null created_on,
       aapb.last_updated_by,

       apex_string.format('Button `%0` in region `%3` (app %1, page %2) is not unique',

        p3 => aapb.region) issue_title,

       aapb.button_name,
       aapb.label,
       aapb.button_attributes,
